clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Cap-assisted Esophagogastroduodenoscopy on Observation of Major Duodenal Papilla
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Cap-assisted Esophagogastroduodenoscopy on Observation of Major Duodenal Papilla: a Randomized Non-inferiority Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Examination of major duodenal papilla (MDP) using a side-viewing duodenoscope is a golden standard. However, side-viewing duodenoscope is not available in some endoscopic centers. Cap-assisted esophagogastroduodenoscopy (Ca-EGD) using a transparent cap fitted to the tip of the scope has emerged as an alternative method for the observation of MDP. A recent study showed that complete examination of MDP could be achieved in 97% of patients. The investigators hypothesize that Ca-EGD is non-inferior to duodenoscope for the observation of MDP.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of complete examination of MDP
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after intubation of the esophagus
primary_outcome.description: Complete examination is defined by visualization of both proximal and distal ends with orifice of papilla

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after intubation of the esophagus
secondary_outcome.description: All pathological findings which are seen in descending duodenum should be reported (e.g. ampullary adenoma, peripapillary diverticulum, ampullary carcinoma, inflammatory change of papilla, etc)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after intubation of the esophagus
secondary_outcome.description: All pathological findings which are seen during the examination should be reported (e.g. reflux esophagitis, gastric cancer, gastric ulcer, duodenal ulcer, etc)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after intubation of the esophagus
secondary_outcome.description: The times taken for the examination of the MDP (after passing the pylorus until examination of MDP)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after intubation of the esophagus
secondary_outcome.description: Score 3 when proximal end, distal end and orifice were visualized; Score 2 when either proximal or distal end with orifice were visualized; Score 1 when either proximal or distal end without orifice was visualized; Score 0 when the MDP could not be localized

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 years and < 70 years
- Patients with native MDP who underwent ERCP
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior surgery in upper GI tract
- Prior history of endoscopic sphincterotomy
- Prior history of MDP treatment
- Known or suspected obstruction of upper GI tract
- Patients in poor condition who may not be suitable for Ca-EGD or duodenoscope
- Pregnancy or lactic women
- Inability to give informed consent
